prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story: My observation is there exists unequal share of State monies with its residents, before all the Urban residents get defensive please hear me out. Presently no one except Corporations pay State income taxes. No individual pays state taxes. I noticed state funded bicycle paths, road maintenance, defunct Docks, powerful politicians pet projects such as office buildings, state troopers etc, etc. all these fundings and more are not necessary within City limits, I was amazed at how much our state provides city functions in the bigger cities thus growing the state budget, I saw on tv last night how adg&g was showing the little ones how to ice fish, couldn't the parents do that? yes I pay property taxes. But I will guarantee you once our City folk get the full bill with out the State monies we will not be as wasteful, on the office building...rent what space you need and help the office rental marked. In my business I just retired from,I would ask my managers, "how do you stop spending money"?
stories: My point is that there's an uneven distribution of state funds among residents, before urban residents get upset, let me explain. Currently, only corporations pay state income taxes, while individuals don't. I've noticed that state-funded projects like bike paths, road maintenance, and politicians' pet projects like office buildings and state troopers are not essential within city limits. These projects, along with others, contribute to the state budget, particularly in larger cities. I was surprised to see how much the state provides city services in these areas. For instance, I saw a TV show teaching children how to ice fish, which made me wonder why parents couldn't do that themselves. As someone who pays property taxes, I believe that if our city residents were fully responsible for their expenses without state funding, they would be more frugal. For example, instead of building an office building, they could simply rent the space they need and help stabilize the office rental market. In my previous business, I would ask my managers, "How do you stop overspending?"

Here is the rephrased text:

My argument is that the allocation of state funds among residents is unfair, so let me clarify. Currently, corporations are the only ones paying state income taxes, while individuals aren't. I've observed that state-funded projects like bike paths, road maintenance, and politicians' pet projects like office buildings and state troopers aren't essential within city limits. These projects, along with others, contribute to the state budget, particularly in larger cities. I was surprised to see how much the state provides city services in these areas. For instance, I saw a TV show teaching children how to ice fish, which made me wonder why parents couldn't do that themselves. As someone who pays property taxes, I believe that if our city residents were fully responsible for their expenses without state funding, they would be more frugal. For example, instead of building an office building, they could simply rent the space they need and help stabilize the office rental market. In my previous business, I would ask my managers, "How do you prevent overspending?"

Here is the rephrased text:

I'm arguing that the distribution of state funds among residents is unfair. Currently, corporations are the only ones paying state income taxes, while individuals are exempt. I've noticed that state-funded projects like bike paths, road maintenance, and politicians' pet projects like office buildings and state troopers aren't essential within city limits. These projects, along with others, contribute to the state budget, particularly in larger cities. I was surprised to see how much the state provides city services in these areas. For instance, I saw a TV show teaching children how to ice fish, which made me wonder why parents couldn't do that themselves. As someone who pays property taxes, I believe that if our city residents were fully responsible for their expenses without state funding, they would be more frugal. For example, instead of building an office building, they could simply rent the space they need and help stabilize the office rental market. In my previous business, I would ask my managers, "How do you prevent overspending?"

I contend that the allocation of state funds among residents is unjust. Notably, corporations are obligated to pay state income taxes, whereas individuals are exempt from taxation. I've observed that state-funded projects such as bike paths, road maintenance, and initiatives like office buildings and state troopers are not crucial within city limits. These projects, along with others, significantly contribute to the state budget, particularly in larger cities. I was astonished to discover the extent to which the state provides city services in these areas. For instance, I came across a TV program teaching children how to ice fish, which led me to question why parents couldn't handle this themselves. As someone who pays property taxes, I believe that if our city residents were fully responsible for their expenses without state funding, they would be more prudent. For example, instead of building an office building, they could simply rent the space they need and help stabilize the office rental market. In my previous business, I would ask my managers, "What measures do you take to prevent excessive spending?"
